title.en: Semantics and Pragmatics of the English Language

description.en: The course analyzes structures of different texts, their idea and connections between the text and its context (theme, cohesion etc.) from the point of view of functional linguistics. The course gives an overview of the theoretical base of linguistic approach to style.
description.et: Vaadeldakse erinevate tekstide ülesehitust ja nende mõistmist ning seoseid teksti ja konteksti vahel (teema, reema, kohesioon jt.) funktsionaalse lingvistika seisukohast. Antakse ülevaade  stiili  lingvistilise käsitluse teoreetilistest alustest.

objectives.en: 1) to introduce the students to the subject of Practical Stylistics, its registers;
objectives.et: 1) tutvustada üliõpilastele praktilise stilistika väljendusvahendeid ja võtteid;

objectives.en: 2) devices and to provide them with theory that is essential for text analysis and interpretation.
objectives.et: 2) varustada üliõpilased teksti analüüsimiseks  ja tõlgendamiseks vajalike teoreetiliste teadmistega.

learning_outcomes.en: 1) is aware of the purpose of the stylistic analysis;
2) distinguishes main methods of stylistic analysis;
3) can classify peculiarities of a text on the level of phonetics, lexis and syntax;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab klassifitseerida teksti stilistilised eripärasused  foneetika, leksika ja süntaksi tasemetel;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) is able to conduct full stylistic analysis of a newspaper or magazine text.
learning_outcomes.et: 4) on võimeline viia läbi ajakirjandusliku teskti täielikku stilistilist analüüsi.

independent_work.et: The detailed description of the volume of independent work is available with the Moodle learning environment of the course (https://moodle.ut.ee/course/view.php?id=1659)

description.et:
Written examination 
A-	Exam questions are answered with maximum precision and reference to corresponding theoretical sources and are supported by references to the sample text; the answer demonstrates a very high level of independent and creative thinking and contributes to well-known interpretations of the text.
B-	Exam  questions are answered correctly and demonstrate very good knowledge of theoretical aspects and reference to the sample text; the answers reveal the ability of critical thinking and creativity at a very good level; it shows the knowledge of literary critics' opinions of the text. 
C-	Exam  questions are answered with various degrees of  precision and demonstrate good knowledge of theoretical aspects and are supported by references to the sample text; the answers  reveal partial readiness of the student to analyse a piece of literature critically; the analysis shows good level of independent thinking.
D-	Answers to exam  questions show the student's  satisfactory knowledge of some theoretical aspects  and do not have any support by example from the sample text; there are some references to other critics' opinions; the answers demonstrate satisfactory level of  independent thinking and creativity;
E-	Exam answers demonstrate student's knowledge of some basic principles of literary analysis and his/her  ability to apply them while analysisng a piece of literature in a conventional way;  the analysis demonstrates a poor  level of  independent thinking and creativity.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in contact hours ( at least 80%), fulfillment of all in-class and home assignments in accordance with the course outline 2022_23 ( see https://moodle.ut.ee/course/view.php?id=1659)

grade_evaluation.et: Terminology test and stylistic analysis of a text

debt_elimination.et: Two weeks to account for each missed test paper

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

topic.et: Stylistics as a linguistic field. Introduction. Lexical stylistic devices. Text analysis
